item.title: Ghislaine add a quote by Esther Friesner
item.description: "Aphrodite had the beauty; Zeus had the thunderbolts. Everyone loved Aphrodite, but everyone listened to Zeus." -- Esther Friesner

item.title: Ghislaine add a quote by Mo Willems
Ghislaine add a quote by Mo Willems
item.description: "I bet your mom would let me." -Pigeon, Don't Let the Pigeon Drive the Bus-" -- Mo Willems

item.title: Ghislaine add a quote by Richard Llewellyn
item.description: "O, there is lovely to feel a book, a good book, firm in the hand, for its fatness holds rich promise, and you are hot inside to think of good hours to come." -- Richard Llewellyn

item.title: Ghislaine add a quote by Jean Cocteau
item.description: "Living is a horizontal fall." -- Jean Cocteau

item.title: Ghislaine add a quote by Irving Stone
item.description: "There are no faster or firmer friendships than those formed between people who love the same books." -- Irving Stone

item.title: Ghislaine add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Ghislaine add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I have never listened to anyone who criticized my taste in space travel, sideshows or gorillas. When this occurs, I pack up my dinosaurs and leave the room." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Ghislaine add a quote by Ken Kesey
item.description: "It isn't by getting out of the world that we become enlightened, but by getting into the world…by getting so tuned in that we can ride the waves of our existence and never get tossed because we become the waves." -- Ken Kesey

item.title: Ghislaine add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Ghislaine add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "If you look for perfection, you'll never be content." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Ghislaine add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Rummaging in our souls, we often dig up something that ought to have lain there unnoticed. " -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Ghislaine add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "I always loved you, and if one loves anyone, one loves the whole person, just as they are and not as one would like them to be. -Dolly" -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Ghislaine add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Ghislaine add a quote by John le Carré
item.description: "A desk is a dangerous place from which to view the world." -- John le Carré

item.title: Ghislaine add a quote by Thomas Babington Macaulay
item.description: "What a blessing it is to love books as I love them;- to be able to converse with the dead, and to live amidst the unreal!" -- Thomas Babington Macaulay

item.title: Ghislaine add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "Love is lak de sea. It’s uh movin’ thing, but still and all, it takes its shape from de shore it meets, and it’s different with every shore." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Ghislaine add a quote by Anchee Min
item.description: "If you can't go back to your mother's womb, you'd better learn to be a good fighter." -- Anchee Min

item.title: Ghislaine add a quote by Derek Walcott
item.description: "The time will come when, with elation, you will greet yourself arriving at your own door, in your own mirror, and each will smile at the other’s welcome." -- Derek Walcott
